abstract.p: Shares in Project Software and Development fall about 28 percent after company says fourth-quarter results will fall short of expectations; decline is sign that business-to-business e-commerce market may be cooling off; graph (S)

block.p: In a new sign that the business-to-business e-commerce market may be cooling off, shares in Project Software and Development fell about 28 percent yesterday after the company said fourth-quarter results would fall short of expectations. Project Software, which is based in Bedford, Mass., and whose clients include companies like General Motors and Eli Lilly, said it expected earnings to be less than the 16 cents a share forecast by financial analysts, and substantially less than the 22 cents a share the company earned in the period a year earlier. The company said reduced demand for its products in Asia had hurt sales.
